result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Buzz A Anwash was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 3 days only if revoked.
On driver's license and all vehicles titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample - surcharge is included in fine.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations which may possibly include inpatient treatment.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week.

timeConds.notes: Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).

records.addlTxt: set to DOC - electronically
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Buzz A Anwash in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Buzz A Anwash in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:18 PM. Cveykus and State have the revocation package with no inaccuracies noted. State - makes final argument prior to recommendation - recommends 4 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES with quite a bit of credit (over 400 days), leaves it up to Court in regards to eligibility for ERP. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - agrees with the recommendation of the State of 4 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - asks the Court to make him eligible for the programs - credit for 412 days. Anwash makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 4 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES  - credit for 412 days, not eligible for programs, right to appeal, adjourned.
Request for Adjournment from Defense Counsel - Approved
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 29, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
for Ignition Interlock Exemptions and Removing Title Transfer Stops - Faxed to DOT
for ignition interlock exemptions and removing title transfer stops - faxed to Wi DOT
The jail term imposed shall be stayed pending Defendant's successful completion of treatment program. If not completed, the defendant shall be required to serve the balance of the sentence.
To Judge Stenz regarding furlough for treatment - copied to DA - Judge not accepting as motion
Associated with Charge #1

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Buzz A Anwash in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:58 PM. Cirilli - have resolution - joint recommendation that the defendant plead g/nc to count #1 as alleged, dismiss counts #2 and #3 - joint recommendaiton of a withheld sentence - place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - huber and good time - 3 days credit, IID, AODA, 2 years DL revocation, fine of 3500.00 inclusive of costs. State and Anwash agree. Court dismsses counts #2 and #3. Anwash pleads NC to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - no objection to receiving credit for attending inpatient treatment. Cirilli - follow joitn recommendation. Anwash withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 3 days only if revoked (stipulated) - report today, fine of $3500.00 inclusive of costs - take bond posted - remainder due in 60 days/CO, AODA and follow thru including potential inpatient if recommended, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, attend at least on AA meeting per week, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars and taverns, obtain GED, 2 years DL revocation, IID on DL and all vehicles titled in his name for 2 years commencing upon issuance of valid DL, 100 hours of community service, submit DNA sample (surcharge included in fine), no voting rights, no possession of firearms, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on January 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on January 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Final pre-trial on October 22, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 3:33 PM. Buzz Anwash appears in person and with counsel Gary Cirilli. State appears by  Charles Simono. State has filed an amended criminal complaint that includes the BAC count. State has also filed an Information that mirrors the amended complaint in anticipation of a waiver of PH. Anwash and Cirilli agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Cirilli has Information, wavies reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 10/22/14 at 1:15 PM.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 17, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 9:01 AM. Buzz Anwash appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Anwash has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney. Anwash states he has hired Gary Cirilli. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 9/3/14 at 1:15 PM. Defendant to instruct Cirilli of this date. Recalled at 9:07 AM, now here with Cirilli, waives time limits. Court continues bond, considers time limits waived, set for PH on 9/17/14 at 3:45 PM.
No consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bar or tavern.
Cash bond set.
